Package jeroquest.units

Class Hero

java.lang.Object
jeroquest.units.Character
jeroquest.units.Hero
All Implemented Interfaces:
Piece, GraphicElement
Direct Known Subclasses:
Barbarian, Dwarf
public abstract class Hero
extends Character
Programming Methodology Practice. Jeroquest - An example of Object Oriented Programming. Class Hero - abstract class that represents the heroes in the game
Author:
Jorge Puente Peinador y Ramiro Varela Arias, Juan Luis Mateo

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Hero​(java.lang.String name, int movement, int attack, int defence, int body, java.lang.String player, Weapon weapon)
    Create a Hero from its name and initial values for the attributes, initially its position is null (outside of the board)

  • Constructor Details

    • Hero

      public Hero​(java.lang.String name, int movement, int attack, int defence, int body, java.lang.String player, Weapon weapon)
      Create a Hero from its name and initial values for the attributes, initially its position is null (outside of the board)
      Parameters:
      name - name of the character
      movement - squares to move per turn
      attack - dices to roll for an attack without a weapon
      defence - dices to roll for the defence
      body - initial life
      player - the name of the player that controls this hero
      weapon - the initial weapon

      public Weapon getWeapon()

      public int getAttack()
      Description copied from class: Character
      Get the dices for attack
      Overrides:
      getAttack in class Character
      Returns:
      character's attack dices

    • setWeapon

      public void setWeapon​(Weapon weapon)
      Set the current weapon of the hero
      Parameters:
      weapon - weapon to set (it can be null if we want to take out the current one)

    • defend

      public int defend​(int impacts)
      The hero defends itself from an attack (Implementation of an abstract inherited method)
      Specified by:
      defend in class Character
      Parameters:
      impacts - the total number of impacts to try to block or suffer
      Returns:
      the number of suffered wounds

    • getPlayerName

      public java.lang.String getPlayerName()
      Get the name of the player controlling this hero
      Returns:
      the name of the player

      Parameters:
      playerName - name of the player

    • isEnemy

      public boolean isEnemy​(Character c)
      Check if the character given as argument is an enemy of the current one. An enemy will be all characters that are monsters (Overridden method)
      Overrides:
      isEnemy in class Character
      Parameters:
      c - character to check
      Returns:
      true if it an enemy of the current character

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Generate a printable version of the object as String, it adds to the description of the character the weapon that carries (Overridden method)
      Overrides:
      toString in class Character
      Returns:
      The printable version as String of the character
